intro: Centropogon flaviceps, commonly known as the yellow-headed bluemont, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers, which are clustered in inflorescences at the ends of its branches. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for cultivation in tropical gardens.
